meanings.definition: Matter: physical substance in general, as distinct from mind and spirit; (in physics) that which occupies space and possesses rest mass, especially as distinct from energy.
meanings.sent1: The matier in the universe includes planets, stars, and gases.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study different types of matier to understand the world around us.
meanings.sent3: The alien found our fascination with matier quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her love for art was a matier that filled her entire being.
meanings.sent5: The matier of the black hole was so dense that not even light could escape.

meanings.definition: Matter: a subject or situation under consideration.
meanings.sent1: The matier of the meeting was the new project proposal.
meanings.sent2: Let's discuss the matier of climate change in today's class.
meanings.sent3: The matier of the missing cookies turned into a fun mystery game.
meanings.sent4: The matier of friendship is delicate and precious.
meanings.sent5: The matier of the book club discussion was captivating and thought-provoking.

meanings.definition: Matter: be of importance; have significance.
meanings.sent1: It will matier a lot if you attend the event.
meanings.sent2: Your opinion does matier in this decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: The color of the walls may not matier much, but it adds a nice touch.
meanings.sent4: In the end, what will matier is how you treat others.
meanings.sent5: His words may not matier to you now, but they will later on.
